title: Ticket #4474: Non-windows job reconnect errors
description:
I thought this reconnect failure was only on windows but with the newly rewritten test we are seeing sporadic failures which are hard to blame on the test. More I have to look at the old test which should have been failing too.

From the log one can see that some of the jobs stay in the run state when the schedd restarts, but in the cases where this reconnection error occurs some of the jobs show up in idle state.

This is true across the platforms failing.

The errors on the reconnect are an automatic failure if a callback for the event is not used to catch the event. Unexpected events have been an automatic failure for about 6 months.

I will update this tickets with userlog and daemon logs for these three which just failed. Ubuntu12(64), debian6(32) and rh5(32)

check_ins: 2014-Jul-28 16:02   Check-in [40764]: shared port was configured by the glue and CondorPersonal #4474 We now have configurable sockdir move to /tmp in condor personal and a separate switch to force shared port. services test had not had the line which has it to turn off shared port. Now it behaves like all regular test and gets USE_SHARED_PORT [...] (By Bill Taylor )
